column1: People who play racquet sports are most likely to injure the tendons on the outside of the elbow.
Golfers are more likely to injure the tendons on the inside of the elbow.
Young children commonly develop "nursemaid's elbow," usually when someone is pulling on their straightened arm.

Other common causes of elbow pain are: - Bursitis -- inflammation of a fluid-filled cushion beneath the skin - Arthritis -- narrowing of the joint space and loss of cartilage in the elbow - Elbow strains - Infection of the elbow
- You have fever or swelling and redness of your elbow.
